item.title: Architecture
item.description: Game development is a complex and challenging process that requires careful planning and execution. One of the key aspects of game development is code architecture, which refers to the organization and structure of the code that powers the game.

item.title: Blog Setup
item.description: This is a How-to Article for quickly setting up a blog with Quartz and Obsidian.md. Prerequisites Obsidian installed on your local machine (because Quartz is Markdown-based) GitHub-Account Basic Knowledge of GitHub and Git.

item.title: First Blog entry
item.description: Hey there, For our games lecture at DHBW Karlsruhe we have to run a blog, where we tell you about our findings and development of our game “A Journey of Music”.

item.title: First Steps with MonoGame
item.description: We can announce, that we have made first steps in MonoGame (literally!). We can move the character up and down, left and right, by inputting the keyboard.

item.title: Game Frameworks
item.description: Game Framework A game framework is a collection of reusable code libraries, modules, and tools that provide a foundation for building games.

item.title: Process of graphical design
item.description: Creating a 2D pixel character with LibreSprite can be a fun and rewarding experience. LibreSprite is a free, open-source software that provides a comprehensive set of tools to help you bring your characters to life.

item.title: Sprite Animations
item.description: After a pause from blogging, we can announce, that we managed to have run our first sprite animations. As MonoGame is only a game framework and not a complete game engine, it means for us, that we had to do much from the ground up, on ourselves.

item.title: Tuning the Blog
item.description: While the development of the game is underway, we want to share our newest developments to this blog. As you know, this blog is based on Quartz, which is based on Hugo.
